meanings.definition: A Japanese poem of seventeen syllables, in three lines of five, seven, and five, traditionally evoking images of the natural world.
meanings.sent1: In school, we learned about haiku poems and their structure.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a beautiful haiku about the blooming cherry blossoms.
meanings.sent3: The haiku about the chirping birds made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her haiku was a window to the serene beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The haiku painted a vivid picture of the peaceful pond.

meanings.definition: A poem written in this form.
meanings.sent1: The students were asked to write a haiku for their assignment.
meanings.sent2: He shared a haiku he composed during his morning walk.
meanings.sent3: The haiku about his messy room was surprisingly funny.
meanings.sent4: Her haiku was a melody of words dancing on paper.
meanings.sent5: The haiku captured the essence of the rainy day perfectly.
